message.content:
cs.LG, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses distributed online learning protocols, which are commonly studied in the machine learning community. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with communication between local learners, which falls under the scope of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper uses information theory to analyze the communication bounds, which suggests cs.IT (Information Theory) as another possible sub-category. The paper also discusses the performance of the protocol in a round-based learning scenario, which falls under the scope of cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper proposes formal criteria for the communication bounds, which suggests cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as another possible sub-category.
